centralQuestion: Is it in the interest of the United States to weaken relations with Canada and Mexico?

reasons.description: Apply tariffs and other economic pressure to compel Mexican cooperation on migration control and fentanyl trafficking, accepting strain on bilateral ties as leverage.

sources.title: POLITICO: 'Trump finalizes tariffs to curb fentanyl and migration'
Reuters: 'Mexico, under pressure from Trump, transfers 26 more cartel members to US'

reasons.description: Confront perceived unfair trade practices by Canada and Mexico—such as Canada’s supply-managed dairy system and Mexico’s GM-corn and energy policies—through dispute escalation and threatened penalties to extract concessions.

sources.title: Reuters: 'USMCA trade panel rejects US complaint about access to Canada dairy market'
Reuters: 'Explainer: Spilt milk? Why are the US and Canada fighting over dairy?'
Reuters: 'US escalates Mexico corn trade spat with dispute panel request'

reasons.description: Protect U.S. manufacturing by limiting exposure to North American imports in autos and metals, encouraging reshoring even if it damages relations.

sources.title: Reuters: 'Trump delays auto tariffs. Pickup trucks might explain why.'
Reuters: 'Trump hits dozens more countries with steep tariffs'

objections.description: North American economic integration under USMCA is central to U.S. competitiveness and supply-chain resilience; weakening ties would harm growth and innovation.

sources.title: Council on Foreign Relations: 'NAFTA and the USMCA: Weighing the Impact of North American Trade'

objections.description: Security cooperation and efficient borders with Canada and Mexico are essential for trade flows, counter-narcotics, and migration management; weakening ties undermines these outcomes.

sources.title: Atlantic Council: 'The Economic Impact of a More Efficient US–Mexico Border'

objections.description: Tariff escalation and confrontational policies raise U.S. prices, invite retaliation, and slow growth, making weakening ties economically costly.

sources.title: Peterson Institute for International Economics: 'Trump's threatened tariffs projected to damage economies of US, Canada, Mexico'
Peterson Institute for International Economics: 'Trump's tariffs damage the US economy more if they drive investors away'

objections.description: Weakening continental ties would undercut U.S. ability to compete with China; a strong North American production platform is strategically advantageous.

sources.title: Council on Foreign Relations: 'US Exporters Won't Thrive in a 'Plus-One' World'
CSIS: 'The USMCA Strategic Initiative: Understanding the Future of North American Trade'

objections.description: Strained relations heighten uncertainty around the 2026 USMCA review, deterring investment and risking the agreement’s durability.

sources.title: Council on Foreign Relations: 'Why the U.S. Presidential Election Matters for the Americas'
CSIS: 'Effects of the Trump Administration's Tariff Threats Against Canada and Mexico'

research.title: 'The Rapid Response Labor Mechanism of the US–Mexico–Canada Agreement'
research.description: World Trade Review article analyzing the USMCA’s labor-rights enforcement mechanism and its implications for North American integration; abstract publicly accessible.

research.title: 'Issue-Areas, Sovereignty Costs, and North Americans' Attitudes Toward Regional Cooperation'
research.description: Peer-reviewed study examining public attitudes toward regional cooperation in North America; open-access abstract (and article available open access).

research.title: 'Toward a New Trilateral Strategic Security Relationship'
research.description: Journal of Strategic Security article proposing frameworks for U.S.–Mexico–Canada security cooperation; open-access PDF.

research.title: 'Sharing the Burden of the Border: Layered Security Cooperation and the Canada–US Frontier'
research.description: Canadian Journal of Political Science article on asymmetric but integrated U.S.–Canada border security cooperation; abstract publicly accessible.

research.title: 'Labour Rights Protection and Its Enforcement under the USMCA: Insights from a Comparative Legal Analysis'
research.description: World Trade Review article assessing USMCA’s labor chapter and enforcement; abstract publicly accessible.
